newsitem.title: USA: No big impact on bonds from US budget deal--Rivlin.
newsitem.headline: No big impact on bonds from US budget deal--Rivlin.

text.p: Federal Reserve Vice Chair Alice Rivlin on Tuesday welcomed the budget agreement between the White House and Congressional leaders, but said she doubted it would have much of an impact on long-term interest rates.
"I'm very pleased about the balanced budget pact," she told reporters after testifying to the House Banking Committee.
"Balancing the budget is good for the economy, which certainly has implications for Fed policy, but it is not critical," she added.
Rivlin added that the budget agreement was unlikely to have much of an impact on the bond market because the budget deficit is already so low.
"It's unlikely to have a big impact on the market," she said.
Analysts have forecast that the deficit this year will likely be under $50 billion. Some even believe that the budget could be balanced next year even without the budget agreement.
